dojg.description: The speaker desires or decides to do something.

examples.japanese: (ksa).私は日本歴史を読もうと思う・思います。
examples.english: I think I will read Japanese history (books).

examples.japanese: (ksb).私はもう酒を飲むまいと思う・思います。
examples.english: I think I will not drink alcohol any longer.

examples.japanese: (a).夏休みに日本アルプスに登ろうと思います。
examples.english: I think I will climb the Japan Alps during summer vacation.

examples.japanese: (b).森さんはワープロを買おうと思っています。
examples.english: Mr. Mori is thinking of buying a word processor.

examples.japanese: (c).僕はあの人とはもう話すまいと思う。
examples.english: I think I won't talk to that person any more.

dojg.writeup: ## 1. When the subject is not the first person, as in Example (b), the nonpast form of 思う cannot be used. Thus, the following sentence is unacceptable.
dojg.formation:
## 

- (i)Vinformal volitional
- と思う
- 話そうと思う
- I think I will talk
- 食べようと思う
- I think I will eat
- (ii)Vinformal nonpast
- まいと思う
- 話すまいと思う
- I think I will not talk
- 食べるまいと思う
- I think I will not eat
